message: ...We climb stairs for what seems like forever, until finally Mink opens a door and steps through.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ngh, haa, haa..."
My forehead is damp with sweat and my vision is distorted from the pain. It feels like my brain is being stabbed with thick needles.
It must be because I used my power earlier.
I take the medicine from my bag and pop the last few pills into my mouth.
Mink glances at me. I swallow the pain and keep walking.
I'm not going to be a burden, not after I demanded he bring me along.
Down the hallway, a red door catches my attention, glaring against the stark, white walls.
I take another step... and bump into something solid. Distracted by my headache, I failed to notice that Mink had come to a stop.
Before I can apologize, a sound tears my focus away.

name: ミンク
message: "They must have finished taking out the trash down there."
The bike bursts from the staircase behind us, then stops at our feet with a screeching of brakes.
Mink turns to look at me.

name: ミンク
message: "I'm sending you back."
Mink's stare tells me to obey.

name: ミンク
message: "You're just gonna slow me down."
His voice is flat and emotionless.
This again? It's just like before. He's trying to push me away.
If I turn back, Mink will press on. He'll complete his objective with ruthless efficiency.
His objective...
To kill Toue...<K> then die.
If I don't stop him now...
...I'll be letting him die.
I know that's what he wants. He can't see any other way.
He doesn't want me to stop him.
...But can I just leave him like this?
No. No matter what happens, I can't let him go.
Even if it means denying him what he most desires, I can't let Mink die for someone like Toue.

name: ミンク
message: "...You really look like shit."
Those are the same words he said after we emerged from Scrap.
Ignoring the persistent headache, I look Mink straight in the eye.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I don't want you to die."

name: ミンク
message: "I'm already dead. I died with my people."
Mink looks away.

name: 蒼葉
message: "That's... That's not true! You're alive! Right now!"
I grab Mink's arm, surprised by the strength of my own emotions.
Mink looks down at me, a barely noticeable frown on his face.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Look, we can touch. You're breathing. What more proof do you need that you're alive?"
Mink pulls his arm away gently.
He doesn't reply. He doesn't have to.
I know Mink's will is as hard as steel, that nothing I can say will get through to him.
Slowly, he turns his back to me, then looks over his shoulder.

name: ミンク
message: "...Sorry for dragging you into this."
And with that, Mink marches off.
And I can't say a word...
...I just stand there and watch him walk through that door.
The lingering smell of cinnamon tickles my nose.
Suddenly, the strength of my headache doubles, almost like it's punishing me for letting Mink go.
...I couldn't stop him. I never had that power.
But now... now...
I fall to my knees, crushed by a wave of regret.
Should I have tried to stop him by any means necessary?
Should I have used the power of my voice?
Even if that wasn't what he wanted?
To force him to live without achieving his goal, or to let him achieve it and die...
Which was the correct choice?
Which would make him happy?
How am I supposed to know?
Even if I could have stopped him, he would have found another way.
Mink's will is just that strong...
...and he has no other path to take.
But that's why I need to choose a path too―a future, and seize it with my own two hands.
I stand up and approach the bike, my back to the door through which Mink vanished.
No more looking back.
